_description: Health Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating health insurance pages

data.intro_content: California operates Covered California, the state health insurance exchange. Average individual premiums are $450/month.
data.requirements_content: The Affordable Care Act requires most Americans to have health insurance. California enforces the individual mandate with penalties.

cost_factors.description: Older adults pay up to 3x more than younger
Smokers can pay up to 50% more

faqs.question: Is health insurance mandatory in California?
faqs.answer: Yes, California has an individual mandate with penalties for non-coverage.

faqs.question: What is Covered California?
faqs.answer: California's health insurance marketplace where you can compare plans and access subsidies.

data.intro_content: Texas has not expanded Medicaid, leading to higher uninsured rates. Average premiums are $420/month on the exchange.
data.requirements_content: While there's no federal mandate penalty, having health insurance protects against catastrophic medical costs.

cost_factors.description: No expansion leaves many without options

faqs.question: Did Texas expand Medicaid?
faqs.answer: No, Texas has not expanded Medicaid, leaving a coverage gap for low-income adults.
